solution_line_template: The contribution of the students amounted to ${student_contribution} x {num_students} = $<<{student_contribution}*{num_students}={total_student_contribution}>>{total_student_contribution}.
So Miss Grayson's class had ${total_student_contribution} + ${initial_fund} = $<<{total_student_contribution}+{initial_fund}={total_fund}>>{total_fund} in all.
The cost of the field trip amounted to ${cost_per_student} x {num_students} = $<<{cost_per_student}*{num_students}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
Therefore, the class of Miss Grayson is left with ${total_fund} - ${total_cost} = $<<{total_fund}-{total_cost}={fund_left}>>{fund_left}.
